headline: Quick and Easy Green Chile Chicken Enchilada Casserole
description: This delicious chicken enchilada casserole recipe simply involves layering shredded chicken with tortillas, sour cream, cheese, and enchilada sauce.

video.description: Try this quick and easy green chile chicken enchilada casserole.
video.name: Easy Chile Chicken Enchilada Casserole

name: Quick and Easy Green Chile Chicken Enchilada Casserole
recipeIngredient: 18 (6 inch) corn tortillas, torn in half
1 (28 ounce) can green chile enchilada sauce
1 (16 ounce) package shredded Monterey Jack cheese
1 (8 ounce) container reduced fat sour cream

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a medium baking dish.

Season chicken with garlic salt; arrange in the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink and juices run clear, about 45 minutes. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
Meanwhile, char each tortilla half over the open flame of a gas stove burner using metal tongs until lightly puffed, about 1 minute.
Pour about 1/2 inch enchilada sauce into the bottom of a medium baking dish; arrange 6 tortillas in a single layer on top.
Sprinkle with 1/2 of the chicken, 1/3 of the cheese, 1/2 of the sour cream, and 1/3 of the remaining enchilada sauce.
Repeat layers. Coat remaining tortillas thoroughly with some of the remaining enchilada sauce and arrange on top. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and top with any remaining enchilada sauce.
Cover and bake in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. Cool slightly before serving.

review.reviewBody: I haven't made this yet, but have been going through the reviews and alternative ideas. This sounds delicious and I'm definitely going to be making it! I will also be adding chopped green onions, and adding cilantro to my dish! Cilantro gives it a very distinct flavor!
Yummy

This was amazing! I read some reviews before I made it, and also changed some things. I used a rotisserie chicken to save some time. A 9 by 13 dish. I used yellow corn tortillas. Monterey Pepper Jack, and nice melting Queso Asidero cheese. I dipped each tortilla in the green Enchilada sauce like someone said. I added some of the remaining on top, with the rest of the cheeses, and voila! It came out perfect. A big hit with the family! Thanks
I made this years ago, and never have stopped serving this dish.

This was a BIG hit in my family - even my picky teenage son went for seconds. I will make this often and even bring it to people who need a meal as I think it'll travel well. I followed it as written with two modifications per other reviews: I put a thin layer of enchilada sauce on the bottom of the 9x13 pan, then mixed the rest with the sour cream to make spreading easier for the layers. I also added half a teaspoon of cumin and a quarter teaspoon of chili powder to the enchilada sauce/sour cream mixture. It really is a fantastic recipe!
It was a little soupy, but also really quick and easy, and everyone loved it.
Added some green chills and onions and it turned out great
It was really mushy. I should have coated the tortillas with green sauce and then start layering them with chicken, a little bit of red salsa, and then with cheese.
My company said this tasted like it was from a restaurant. I followed the recipe with no changes. Its a keeper.
The only change I made (since I don't have a gas stove) was to add crumbled yellow corn chips instead of tortillas. Everyone asks me to bring this to potlucks. So good!
Delicious and satisfying. I used a street taco verde sauce since it was in my cabinet and it worked fine. Next time I might try queso blanco for fun, since I just really like the tase.
Very easy to make and delicious!! Big hit with the whole family!
I’ve made a slightly different version of this recipe (add petite diced tomatoes and cumin). Love it! Easy and yummy.

I have been making a recipe almost exactly like this for years. By cutting out a few steps, you can make this and the flavor is just as good, if not better. I do put a bit of the green enchilada sauce on the bottom. I tear tortillas in half so I can line them around the edges of the pan and they just use whole ones to fill the rest of the space in. I take the green enchilada sauce, a small can of green chilis, and sour cream and mix it into a sauce. I then add rotisserie chicken into the sauce. Pour half over the tortillas, then add shredded cheese, which can be anything, Mexican blend, Colby Jack or Mozzarella or a mixture. Just whatever you have. Repeat starting with tortillas and then the mixture, top with remaining enchilada sauce and cheese. Cover and bake for about 30 minutes. I usually use the smaller can of enchilada sauce to do this, but still make it in the 9 X 13 pan. If you don't want to make that much, or just have a bit of chicken left over, then use a 9 X 9 pan, a 7 X 11 pan and adjust your ingredients accordingly. I'm kind of a "no measure cook", put in what looks and tastes right. This is a pretty no fail recipe no matter how you do it, as long as you stick to the basics.

I've made this many times and it's always a big hit with family and friends. Goes fast at potlucks so be ready for that. I use either boiled or rotisserie chicken, shredded, and I don't dip the tortillas in the enchilada sauce. They get nice and moist cooking in the casserole dish. I also use less cheese but get the 4 cheese fiesta blend already shredded, so it's tasty and quicker. I highly recommend sharing this out!
Mushy meh. It was okay, we mostly ate what we served, but I doubt anyone will touch the leftovers and the kids and husband all agreed it's not a repeater.
Very easy. I did not char the tortilla shells. Substituted Cheddar Cheese.

This recipe was delicious!! I cooked my chicken in the instapot, and added 1 can of cream of chicken & some chopped onion to the chicken/sour cream mixture (mixed all together like others suggested before layering.) I baked as instructed, but next time will bake uncovered, as I had to add some additional time to get the cheese on top to my liking.
Will be making this again and again. Very tasty and very easy to make.
My husand loved the chicken enchilada casserole I made last night . I added half a can of rotel to the casserole. I Let it set for 15 min after taking out of oven. Definitely will make again.
Awesome!!! So easy
My family loved it!

My husband said I hit a grand slam with this one. I gave just 4 stars to be fair because I made changes. I also halved the recipe as there are just the 2 of us. Pulled the chicken while still hot, meat always shreds easiest when still hot. Then mixed it with the sour cream and some green chili's. I did not chat the tortillas, only cut/tore them to fit dish, and dipped them in the enchilada sauce. I put sauce in bottom of dish, layered tortillas-chicken mixture-cheese-tortillas-chicken mixture-cheese-tortillas. Poured the remaining sauce on top and baked for 30 minutes. Added rest of cheese, onions and olives (on half) and baked another 15 minutes. It rocked y'all. Don't be afraid to adjust. I can already think of other things to try...... jalapenos, chopped tomatoes, or avacado.

Thanks for the recipe! I used nonfat Greek yogurt for the sour cream and added a package of taco seasoning to it then mixed with the chicken to spread more easily, as others have suggested. I tore the tortillas in half then charred them in a cast iron skillet. This is a good recipe on its own, but also good as a base recipe for you to add whatever you like or have on hand.

This was a GREAT recipe. I made minor changes: don't have gas burner so didn't do any prep for the tortillas, added green chiles and a little cumin and topped with sliced green onions. My husband said he could eat a VAT of it. Will definitely save this recipe to make again!
I used twice the amount of sour cream. This dish was fantastic!
It was very good. My husband doesn't like green sauce so I used red enchilada sauce. I also added a can of diced green Chiles.
Wonderful. I will be making this again.

The recipe is basically pretty darn good, but like others, I made some flavor-enhancing changes:

I like chicken, so I added another breast, and that made it very hearty. Also, like some others, I mixed the sour cream and chicken together, making it easier to spread. I sauteed diced jalapeno and half an onion and added them to the mixture, as well as some store bought pico de gallo. 

Outstanding! Very hard to stop eating it.

I read several of the reviews and made the following changes: boiled the chicken breasts with garlic and onion powder until fully cooked. Then shredded. I only put enough sauce in the bottom to cover the surface. 1/2 inch was too much. Then placed 6 tortillas on top. I did not cut them or tear them. I did not char them. Mixed 2/3rds of the remaining sauce and all of the sour cream with the shredded chicken. Put half of the chicken mixture on top of the tortillas. Covered in cheese. Dipped the next 6 tortillas in sauce and placed on top of the cheese. Then put the rest of the chicken mixture on top of the tortillas. And covered in cheese. There was no more sauce left. So I just put the remaining 6 tortillas on top and covered with the remaining cheese. Placed in 350° oven until cheese was completely melted. Let set for 10 minutes then served.
I omitted the sour cream and added green chilies on top of the sauce. My family loved it.
My family all loved this and went back for seconds!
Spouse loved this! (I don't eat meat)

This was delicious. After baking the chicken breasts as directed ahead of time, I mixed in the sour cream, a small can of green chiles and some homemade taco seasoning (using a recipe from this site) and put in frig until next day. 
I used 2 smaller cans of green enchilada sauce and poured one in the bottom of a glass 9x13 dish. I tore the tortillas in fourths and put a third of them down, then spread half the chicken mixture and cheeses (as directed). I dipped the rest of the tortilla fourths into the second can and finished assembling as directed. This was so yummy! I pinned to my 'Feed a Crowd Easy' board and will make for extended family when they visit our cabin in summertime. Thanks for sharing and thanks for the tips from other reviewers!

I used a combo of mist everyone’s comments. I too cooked the chicken on the stove. Next time I will add the taco seasoning as was recommended. Even so - this was amazing. My husband is a bit picky and really liked just crunchy tacos. He said this is his favorite now!! Thank you for this recipe!
very easy and delicious. The second time I used already shredded chicken and slices of pepper jack cheese. Even better.
Amazing dish! Shredded the chicken my hand and mixed it with the sour cream and it turned out perfect. Used more cheese than it called for and I don’t regret it!

I've made this pretty often. A good recipe, but a bit bland as written. The first time I made it, I made it exactly as written. It was good, but bland like I said. After that when I make it, I don't char the tortillas and I do like another reviewer mentioned and mix in the sour cream. That just makes it easier to put everything together. I don't notice a difference with charring vs not charring, minus just saving time. To the sour cream mixture I add some of the Trader Joe Chili Lime seasoning and that seems to give it a little more flavor. I use canned enchilada sauce but I add cilantro and some green chilis. With these simple modifications the recipe is a keeper
Simple and delicious if you like green sauce. I also added salsa ranchera
I have made this many times. I take the advice of another reviewer and mix the sour cream with the shredded chicken. Awesome recipe.
Love this recipe. I char the corn tortillas, then dip them in the enchilada sauce. I use a rotisserie chicken, shred and mix in a can of mild green chilis. This is delicious!

I made it for my husband for Father's Day from our kiddos and he LOVED, LOVED it. I made a large 13x9 dish & it's gone! I always end up throwing leftovers away, but there were NO LEFTOVERS tonight. It was really easy to make which is good because I have a lot of physical disabilities that prevent me from cooking. I did use the InstaPot (IP) to cook the meat in, with a can of green sauce. It made the meat so easy to pull apart & put the dish together. I do think it's easier to mix the sauce (and/or the juice from the meat) with the sour cream, then pour onto the casserole - it spreads easier & more evenly. I thought it was great! We'd do it again. In fact, my husband has already asked when I will make it again.

I guess I used the basic idea of the recipe but changed it up a bit. I shredded my chicken and blended it with 1/2 can of cream of chicken soup and 1/2 block cream cheese added frozen corn, can of chopped green chili’s, green onions and black olives. Also like to add chopped roasted red peppers for color. Turns out wonderful.

Followed the recipe with one change....didn't char the tortillas....they totally disintegrated anyway so I got a gloppy sloppy mess.....not even close to the picture. Can't imagine why the results are so different. Thank goodness I just made this for my husband and son...didn't look good but tasted ok.
We loved this recipe, and so did our guests. I made some modifications according to one of the reviews I read. In the end it took more time doing it that way but it was worth it.
This turned out great. I served it with chopped lettuce, chopped tomatoes and olives. This gave it a little crunch

Super easy to throw together, especially since I had pre-cooked chicken to use up. Didn’t worry about spreading the sour cream, just did dollops since it would melt when baking. Also did not toast the tortillas, don’t have a gas stove and besides it absorbs liquid better if the tortillas are just raw. Since it calls to bake covered, I uncovered and put it under the broiler for a few minutes before I pulled it out.
It was so good
I’ve been making a similar recipe to this for years so I thought I would try something different and it was great, thanks!

This was a hit, I'll definitely be adding this into rotation often! I made this tonight and it was amazing. I did not add the sour cream to the dish but offered it as an option on the side. I also soaked the top layer of tortillas in half of the sauce while I was preparing all the ingredients to layer. My casserole had just the right amount of moisture and wasn't soupy as others suggested.
This was delicious. My family loved it

I followed the recipe and even put in less of the enchilada sauce per some of the other reviews here, but it still turned out soupy and fairly unflavorful. The longer it sat, the less soupy it became but it just needed more flavor. The sour cream separated, which looked unappetizing but was ok. Maybe try more spices and adding veggies, salsa or beans. I probably won't make again.
My family loved this recipe!
The first time I made this it was a disaster! (I heard "two tablespoons" instead of "to taste" with the garlic salt. I cleaned out my ears and made it again AS WRITTEN and it was fantastic!

Great recipe. I make my chicken enchilada casserole similarly, except I mix the sour cream with the shredded chicken because it mixes better, and I add a can off green chilies and sliced black olives to the layers. I always get rave reviews!
Simple and delicious!
Delicious I added onion and green chillis to the recipe and it was a hit
So easy and delicious. Makes a ton!
yes
Very good!!

Quick, easy and delicious! Made exactly as written but did not char the tortillas, and DID mix sour cream into chicken before layering. (Wasnt sure what "a medium baking" dish meant, but used a 9X13 baking dish and fit perfectly)
Delish, easy and healthy!
Easy to make. Full of flavor. I added chipotle peppers for a little extra heat. My family loved this dish.
I added 1/3 cup off roasted Hatch green chilis. Delightful!
I forgot the sour cream, so we added it on top before serving. Much easier than regular enchiladas. Will definately make again.
Always a hit!

I followed the directions exactly, except I used shredded rotisserie chicken from Costco. It was a soupy, sloppy, soggy and bland mess. The sour cream broke down and though it wasn't curdled in flavor, it had the appearance of being curdled. It wasn't a pleasant sight in the plate at all. I was actually embarrassed to present it to my family.
I added about a cup of frozen corn, a can of black beans rinsed, a 4 oz can of sliced black olives and a 4 oz can of green chopped chiles drained. Very good and everyone went back for seconds.
It was very easy, but didn't have much flavor. I will try again but probably double up on the seasonings.

My family loves this recipe. The kids always gobble it up and ask for seconds, and they never ask for seconds for anything! It's a good recipe for kids to help make, too. I have given it to friends and they like it as well.

I make the shredded chicken in my instant pot, cool it, and mix with the sour cream. I also do what the reviewer suggested about coating the tortillas in the sauce by dipping in a pie plate. 

I use garlic powder or garlic salt, whichever I have on hand. But I think the recipe is best with garlic powder added liberally and then salt added to taste. You can only add so much garlic salt before it's too salty, but by using the powder, you can add as much garlic as you want and not add too much salt

Throw your chicken into a crock-pot along with a small (drained) can of tomatoes and chilis. I also added a dash of onion and garlic powder. Cook on low for a couple of hours. ( stir it up after an hour or so). Don't overcook it ..drain any liquid. When cool, shred the chicken with tomatoes and all. I followed other suggestions....cut up the tortillas and soak in the green enchilada sauce. I sauteed 1/2 of a finely-diced onion, jalapeno and garlic clove. ..5-10 minutes. Add the shredded chicken, sour cream, juice of a lemon, handful of chopped cilantro and a few dashes of taco seasoning. Mix it up. Taste and adjust seasonings as preferred. Layer with sauce at the bottom, tortillas, chicken mixture and don't skimp on the cheese ! I mixed sharp cheddar with the Jack cheese. WOW....fantastico !

I made this a few days ago, The Charred tortillas really make this recipe. I used whole corn tortillas. I also added a package of Birds eye southwest proteins Its a steam fresh variety. I layered this with everything else. I also cooked my chicken breast in my crock pot with the enchilada sauce all day. Served with my homemade salsa on the side . It turned out great. Thanks for sharing the recipe.
I used too much green sauce, unfortunately, but thought it had a nice flavor. I also used 6 large flour tortillas instead of corn. I’ll try this one again and use much less sauce!

We enjoyed this very much. I did make a couple of changes though. I used my favorite brand of tortilla chips in place of frying corn tortillas. I also added refried beans and used leftover grilled chicken breasts.
Great recipe that can be tweeked to your taste.

Excellent and easy casserole. I added sautéed onions, garlic and two jalapeños to boost the flavor as well as fresh corn, taken off the cob, and a can of drained black beans. The entire can of green enchilada sauce, 28 oz, was perfect amount as the casserole was moist but not gloppy. Will make again particularly if I have leftover rotisserie chicken.
I was looking for a recipe to use up some leftover carnitas and I'm glad I came across this one. It was exactly the taste I was going for. Delicious.
My family loved it! It's so much easier not having to roll the enchiladas. My new way of making enchiladas.

This casserole turned into a sloppy mess with soggy tortillas and goo. It needs more substance. Perhaps the corn tortillas should be toasted first and green onions, peppers and beans should be added into it. 
Very disappointed. I guess I'm an Authentic Tex-Mex cuisine girl.
I made this for dinner one night and my husband loved it! Really easy to put together. Will make again for sure!
MADE THIS DELICIOUS DISH ALONG WITH A FEW TWERKS OF MY OWN...MY FAMILY LOVED IT!!! They fought over who would have the last!!! Can't wait to make it again

My family loved it. My teenage son's frriends said if rating as 10 is the highest, they would give it a 10.2. I modified the recipe a bit. I cooked frozen chicken breasts in the crock pot with onion and spices. Added diced chilis, chili powderr, fresh garlic, garlic salt, and taco seasoning to the chicken after I cut it up.
This recipe is awesome! Made it last night. I did add jalapeno peppers, red bell peppers, and chives. We like spicy food!

I am not really a fan of rating recipes unless I made it exactly as the recipe says but in this case after looking over the recipe and then reading many reviews, I agreed with most, that a few alterations were needed, in my opinion. I pretty much followed the original recipe but added a small can of chopped green chilies, also used extra chicken breasts and a bit more sour cream to compensate for extra chicken, and mixed the sour cream with the shredded chicken for more even distribution. Also mixed in fresh chopped cilantro, just because I love cilantro! I liked the idea from other reviews of not toasting the tortillas because I did not want that crispy texture, and then dipped the pieces of corn tortillas into the enchilada sauce vs pouring sauce into baking dish, as recipe says. Came out very good! Also garnished with chopped scallions. I think the title Quick & Easy justify the original recipe. It is a good base or starter recipe, enabling you to be more creative, which is what cooking is all about! I did not give it 5 stars just because it's a bit heavy, but very delicious! Maybe I should just learn to have a smaller piece!
I love green chili enchilada sauce so I thought this was very good. I only added some chopped cilantro on top of each sour cream layer.

Family loved it. Will make it again. Adjustments I made are:
Used rotisserie chicken. Shredded it. Cooked it with 1 onion, 1 red pepper, 1 can mild diced chilis, 1 package taco seasoning. Let liquid cook off for about 10 minutes. 

Did not mix sour cream into chicken. Added it later at table.

Easy and delicious! 
I followed all the instructions except I didn't do the burner with tortillas. I also mixed the sour cream in with shredded chicken to make it easier. Yummy!
I love this recipe. Very easy and quick to make, clean up is a breeze, and to top that off, it is delicious. This recipe goes into my very favorite recipe box.

No changes were made to the recipe and it turned out great, everyone loved it so we will be making it again.
Genny

This is an awesome and simple recipe. To make is easier is used two rotisserie chickens.

Boom! Dinner.

Will definitely make this again. I didn't char the tortillas as I don't have flame stove top burners, but it didn't turn out soggy at all just adding them soft. I think next time I might add some black beans to it!
I omitted sour cream and added onions . It was delicious. I will make again. Charring the tortillas is a great idea. It adds allot to the flavor.

Loved the flavor the charred tortillas added. I had to un-spice mine to fit tastebuds in my household and it was still very tasty. Planning to make a rendition of this recipe again. Served with black olives, sour cream and chopped green onion. Served with Zataran's Cilantro Lime rice which was a tasty choice.

This one is a keeper. I made some minor changes based on what I had in my fridge and the comments. I used two packages (9 oz. I think) of the Perdue pre-cooked chicken breast strips. I cut them up into smaller pieces and mixed them with sour cream and some taco seasoning and garlic powder. I used nine corn tortillas, three in each layer, and I did not cut them up or char them first. I also used Mexican cheese since that's what I had on hand. I only used 20 oz of green chile sauce.

Great simple recipe. Always perfect. I adjust the portions smaller because of my small family and when cooking the chicken I add taco seasoning for a little extra kick. Great when you have left over chicken.
The flavor was bland, needed extra sauce.
This is good y'all. Seriously, use tortilla chips (crushed or while) instead of the tortillas. You'll be glad you did. ??

This was great. I made some minor changes based on availability of ingredients. I had a 12 oz jar of enchilada sauce from Trader Joe's, and used all of that plus all of a jar of red salsa to take the place of the 28oz can of sauce. It worked and tasted fine. Tearing and soaking the tortillas in the sauce in a pie tin helped to soften them. I wish there was a little more sauce. Mixing the shredded chicken and sour cream helped a lot too during the spreading of layers. This 9x13 pan provided many meals throughout the week for work lunches. It was plated with green onion and cilantro on top, and a dollop of greek yogurt, and a side of canned refried beans (Amy's are good).

We used leftover cooked chicken breasts, probably only about 1/3 the amount the recipe called for and it was plenty of chicken and delicious. We also were a little short on the corn tortillas so supplemented with some broken up tortilla chips for the top layer. We just mixed them with the enchilada sauce and it worked out perfectly. Also forgot to cover it while baking. This could be the best chicken enchilada casserole I've ever made and I think this recipe would be equally good with leftover pork roast .

item.name: Quick and Easy Green Chile Chicken Enchilada Casserole
